div.p: Yesterday I sent by express a box containing two Photographic albums one for Hattie and the other for Charlie they must determine which one each is to have there being only a slight difference in the colour - I sent several Photographs, in them of myself one for each ofthe girls. today I wrote Sister Maria and sent her one and also to Martha and sent one to her I will send you some more by degrees. I have had 12 taken for $5,00 you may send one to Key Unit if you please. There is considerable talk of giving up this place as a trading Port which will be back for Mr as I in that care wil lhave to lookout for some thing else to do I hope however that it will not be abandoned as I want to remain here but the state of affairs is so unsettled that one cannot tell what a day may bring forth - so let us hope for the best, the 150. dollars I sent you was for a few I have not drawn any of my salary as yet not having been to Memphis since the bid was done nor do I expect to go untill

first of February. The last few days we have had pleasant weather for the frost is undo of the ground and the sun is like a fiery I hope I may be able to have you here before another winter The Mocking birds are flying about but not singing there are numbers that head here every summer and I will try and get some next spring you may give Bill the Boots. Mack repaired as I had had two pair given me - give him all my corduroy pants and any other you may think fit. I have got another Muffler so that you can make a muff out of the one I left my darling I hope the dancing there was a good one and thaned you all out you dont know how much I thought of you in the cold weather and fear that you suffered more than you tell me. I will make this short and send another picture - kiss all my children for me - Tell Perigo that I will unto for him as soon as things are settled
Get Bill a pair of shoes in lieu of the Boots
